channel.title: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks
channel.description:
Hey, ok well... me and my freinds are making a server, this isnt my first but its my first one in 2 years. and when i finished designing client this is outcome:
[img]http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/6240/clientproblem.png[/img]
The fire and the runescape sign, cant figure out how to get them to go away. So if you can help me i would very much apreciate it.
Thanks!

item.title: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks
item.dc:creator: @warlock_999 warlock 999
item.description:
@warlock_999 wrote:

method51 is the logo and search google for the flames. Tons of tuts have been made for that.

Read full topic

i am also trying to remove the flames ty dork for the rs logo the flames umm blurr told me how to on the other site which i dont want to name and he gave me the wrong thing so ty for nothing just if nayone stumble upon this and can help it’d be appreciated

item.title: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks
item.dc:creator: @killer117 killer117
item.description:
@killer117 wrote:

I’ve been trying to delete the some things on that exact client, I found how to deal with the Runescape logo, but luckily dork20001 above found an easier way for ya :rolleyes:. But I’m still looking for the flames part…

Read full topic
item.source: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks

item.title: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks
item.dc:creator: @dork20001 dork20001
item.description:
@dork20001 wrote:

well i seen ur post and i wanted to help for you and myself so far i figured out how to remove the runescape sign
umm well open up your clientlass9.java and then search using the ctrl+f and search for flame twice
then youll see
//method 56 something do with flames
method56(0);
make the 0 a -1 and then save and compile and rs sumbol is gone im working on getting the flames gone but really dont know how its not as easy is that.

Read full topic
item.source: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks

item.title: Pwnscape 3 client help. Please and thanks
item.dc:creator: @coole210 coole210
item.description:
@coole210 wrote:

go to your class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 look for image image (CTRL + F < to find it)

and change it to background.png or you can make it a moving picture (.GIF) or you can replace the image image with an uploaded picture like photobucket or image shack heres what you replace it with :

				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("URLOFTHEIMAGE"));

Read full topic
